# 📚 Year 1: Foundation Building
## Establishing Core Knowledge & Skills

> **The journey begins with solid fundamentals in economic theory, mathematical methods, and data science**

This foundational year established essential skills across microeconomics, macroeconomics, mathematics, statistics, and programming that form the basis for advanced economic analysis.
:::

## 🗓️ Academic Year Overview

### 📅 Semester 1 (Fall 2022)
**Theoretical Foundations**

| Course Code | Course Name | Focus Area | Key Concepts |
|-------------|-------------|------------|--------------|
| **SOK-1003** | Microeconomics | Individual Decision Making | Supply/demand, market equilibrium, consumer theory |
| **SOK-1004** | Macroeconomics | National Economic Systems | GDP, inflation, unemployment, fiscal policy |

### 📅 Semester 2 (Spring 2023)  
**Quantitative Methods & Applications**

| Course Code | Course Name | Focus Area | Key Skills |
|-------------|-------------|------------|------------|
| **[SOK-1005](Semester%202/Sok-1005/)** | Data Science for Economists | Programming & Analysis | R, statistical analysis, data visualization |
| **SOK-1006** | Statistics | Statistical Methods | Hypothesis testing, regression, probability |
| **SOK-1016** | Mathematics for Economists | Mathematical Foundations | Calculus, optimization, linear algebra |

## 🔬 Featured Projects

### 🌡️ SOK-1005: Global Temperature Analysis
**Comprehensive Data Science Application**

This flagship project demonstrates the integration of economic thinking with advanced data science techniques, analyzing global climate data and its potential economic implications.

**Technical Achievements:**
- **Data Integration**: Multiple climate datasets
- **Statistical Analysis**: Time series decomposition
- **Visualization**: Interactive ggplot2 graphics
- **Documentation**: Professional Quarto reports

**Economic Applications:**
- Climate change economic impacts
- Trend analysis and forecasting
- Policy implications assessment
- Cross-regional comparisons

[🌡️ View Complete Project](Semester%202/Sok-1005/Project/index.html){.btn .btn-primary}

### 🔢 SOK-1016: Mathematical Modeling
**Advanced Economic Applications**

Mathematical foundations course featuring optimization problems, calculus applications, and theoretical modeling relevant to economic analysis.

**Key Topics:**
- Optimization in economic contexts
- Constraint satisfaction problems
- Function analysis and derivatives
- Linear algebra applications

[📐 View Mathematical Work](Semester%202/SOK-1016/){.btn .btn-outline-primary}
